pros: This is a top-quality hospital with top-quality employees from the food workers to the patient care personnel to the upper level executives.
cons: Hard times call for hard decisions. Even the best hospital in town has to make cuts. Some departments are not valued as much as others (depending on how much money they bring in for the hospital) so salaries aren't always equal.

pros: Friendly coworkers; some good team work among staff
cons: Bad management from the top down; no raises, no cola unless you are a nurse; no work life balance and no attempts by management to better that situation

review_title: Comes with hands on learning with poor benefits
pros: Friendly people, opportunities to learn on your own. Great place to learn and leave.
cons: Long hours with no exchange for time off. Health benefit cost increase with no pay increases, no paid training OR access to online training unless you pay for it.

review_title: Worst company I've ever had in my life
pros: The only pro was the schedule Mon-Fri
cons: Everything besides the schedule. You would think working in a hospital the pay would be decent right?? Lol, think again!! You would be paid more working for Walmart than here I kid you not! Management was terrible, they don't care if you sick all that matters to them are numbers. I was never trained I shadowed someone for a few days and then I was on my own. You basically have to teach yourself. The atmosphere in the business center was very dry and boring. They also make you use your own vacation time for company holidays. Basically, they give you a bucket of hours and you have to "budget them" throughout the year. If you don't have the hours available when holiday comes you then have to come in work. (Crazy, I know...couldn't believe this myself when I found out). I really could go on and on about the cons, but I rather not even waste my time. Whoever is reading this...do yourself a favor and apply somewhere else and save yourself from misery. If you're looking for a good job that offers growth opportunities, management that cares about the wellbeing of their employees, equality, good benefits and pay. This is NOT the place for you, trust me!!!

job_title: Gift Shop Clerk in Augusta, GA
pros: great hours, rewarding job, opportunities for transfers to other departments, employee health clinic
cons: All time off comes from one PTO bank without the option to take unpaid time off. Raises are almost non existent in the administration staff.

pros: Upper management picks favorites , if you’re not in that group you are out. You have to be like a puppet to make it. How quickly they change.
cons: Too many people In charge.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant (CMA) in Augusta, GA
pros: I really enjoy working with all my co-workers.
cons: We're always under-staffed and don't make enough money.

job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Augusta, GA
pros: You can make as much money as you want when they really need extra help
cons: It's not a lot of team work.

review_title: Used to be a great Hospital... things have changed.
job_title: ICU Registered Nurse in Augusta, GA
pros: Close to my home. Have worked there for over 20 years.
cons: Lost it's Magnet status. Hiring too many travel nurses instead of working to retain the ones they have.

pros: It’s a Great place to work
cons: None that I can think of

Overtime availability 
Flexible schedule
3 day work week

job_title: Emergency Medical Technician-A (EMT-A) in Augusta, GA
pros: Great people, management listens to an extent.
cons: Pay for techs/pcas is not as competitive as other area hospitals.

review_title: Billing Office for University Hospital (PFS) is one of the worst places I've ever worked for.
job_title: Payment Posting Specialist in Augusta, GA
pros: The only pros I can think of is you'll have weekends off and a set schedule.
cons:
There are so many cons I don't think I have enough space but here are the main ones:
1. Low pay
2.Highly overworked
3. Expect extreme micromanagement
4. Discriminative
5. No growth opportunities
6. Costly benefits
7. No raise
8. No incentives
9. Favoritism
10. Unclean workplace
11. Company paid holidays are included in you vacation and sick time. So if you have to use it, guess what...you won't get paid for that holiday!!!
12. Lack of solid training program for new hires. You are likely to train yourself!!

pros: Great place to learn. New technologies being used.
cons: Management. Pay. Communication. Lack of follow through.

pros: Caters to new nurses. Great orientation. I feel like they care about their nurses. Good environment. Best hospital I’ve worked for so far.
cons: Pay wasn’t as high as other hospitals. Not easy to transfer departments.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Gibson, GA
pros: Good experience opportunities for newer nurses.
cons: Scheduling will have you burned out quickly.

pros: Good support from boots-on-the-ground. Some good resources available for nurses. Great weekend differential.
cons: In intensive care, staff are given too many patients to take care of. The team is excellent and the nurses and RTs are great so we make do, but nobody is happy - and it's been this way for a long time.

pros: Family like atmosphere, keep ratios even if it means holding beds
cons: Leadership is spread to thin,

pros: Great management, always had a resource
cons: Experienced a lot of floating

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Augusta, GA
pros: Doctors and staff are very knowledgeable
cons: University does not give bonuses or contribute to my 401K

pros: friendly staff (most of the time), good food options, good charting system
cons: unreliable hours due to flexing

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in San Antonio, TX

cons: Understaffed for outpatient nursing which causes you to go over your time

pros: Good work environment. Good colleagues.
cons:
Below average pay
Poor support from administration

pros: Pay was on par or slightly better than nearby hospitals
cons: Management did not seem to appreciate the rigors and stressors on the nursing staff

pros: Leadership was good from my experience
cons: Not enough training opportunities to say the least

pros: Respectful atmosphere, flexibility, wonderful providers
cons: Administration tells you they want you to advance but no follow thru

pros: benefits, time off, good hands on experience, tuition reimbursement

pros: Great place to start expanding your career in healthcare.
cons: Can be too political at times.

job_title: Director of Information Technology in Augusta, GA
pros: Great place to work that really tests your skill
cons: Hard to list a con. It’s a great place.

pros: Great coworkers and supportive work environment
cons: A little bit older structure

review_title: Not what it used to be....
pros: There are some good people there who truly care about patients.  Lots of people want to have the organization thrive!  Nice home town hospital as a patient.  This used to be the place to work.  It is not anymore and it's sad.
cons: Communication is poor.  Leadership is lacking.  They seem more concerned with getting to retirement or impressing Novant staff than taking care of the staff and the patients.  Issues are swept under the rug.  There is no promotional ladder unless you know someone.  There are people in leadership who are not qualified to be there.  Personnel is not consistent with following the job descriptions.  People are not held accountable if they are in leadership positions.  You can not express your opinion without the fear of retation.

review_title: A poor choice for advancement within the IT career path, but a perfect stepping stone.
job_title: IS Support Technician II in Augusta, GA
pros: Decent wages for IT personnel, not great ... but decent.  Healthcare experience and opportunity to learn from others that will share in their experience with you (if they feel like it).
cons: Very political atmosphere, with a concern for the bottom dollar at all times.  No cost of living increases, sub 3% pay raises (if one is given at all).  No training reimbursement.  Poor medical insurance, and costly.  Management and Salaried employees have a very large pay gap between employees.

pros: I have health benefits for myself and children. Able to purchase uniforms through my employer. Currently work with great nurses. They do offer tuition reimbursement.
cons: Under paid and over worked. Their no true raises unless you pay to get more accreditation. You are stuck with the employer for another year if you do receive tuition reimbursement or pay an addition amount for leaving early. And you will receive a write up if you a min late for work and or if you call out even if it is the night before.

job_title: Medical Bill Auditor in Augusta, GA
pros: Easy access from 520 and plenty of parking.
cons: Once you get a position there, that's the only thing you'll be doing. There's no help from management or supervisors to grow professionally. They are so cheap and unwilling to pay for resources to get your job done. The doctors don't seem to care if their charts are incomplete or incorrect, but somehow it's your job to get the chart billed out anyway. Don't ever expect a raise. The director talks to employees like they're children, but some of them act like children so I don't know which is worse. Toxic culture.

review_title: On boarding is a slight pain as a new grad, but hopefully worth it.
job_title: New Grad RN in Augusta, GA
pros: Hospital seems to put more money and effort into caring for patients than many others in the area. Shift differential is great.
cons: Recruiter didn’t keep me in the loop throughout the process. Pay is on the low side of average. Have to wear royal blue scrubs.

pros: The best reason is everybody nice. And its not hard work at all I love talking to patients. Making them smile.
cons: The downsides is when we have to go from floor to floor to do rooms when we still have our own rooms to finish.

pros: UH has the best staff, from housekeeping to nursing supervisors; truly feels like my work "family."
cons: There have been too many changes that ultimately do not benefit the patients or staff.

pros: I loved what I was doing
cons: Intimidation and lack of communication with director.  Getting rid of older employees close to retirement or who have suffered injuries, had to have surgeries, etc. Lack of compassion.

pros: This established facility is a great atmosphere.   You really feel like family here.  Great doctors...great nurses...wonderful working environment.
cons: The pay is not as competitive as it should be.  It's reasonable, but not where it should be to keep employees. The benefits are great though.

review_title: Hard work for very little money
pros: Great health coverage options and benefits and availability of employee pharmacy where meds are significantly cheaper than at other pharmacies
cons: Very little compensation for an incredibly difficult and detail-oriented position with very little opportunity for growth or upward mobility within the agency

pros: Great benefits, Health insurance, Paid Time Off, Bonus plans, Advancement opportunities, Positive Environment.
cons: Average pay - What you don't get in extra pay is easily made up in benefits, stability and the pride of knowing that you work for a great system.

review_title: Best place to work and get care!
pros: Like family. I worked at UH for 14 years before I retired. They cared about me as a person.
cons: Hospitals are a difficult environment for managers in this new health care age.

review_title: Want excellent patient care, but stretch their nursing staff thin...

cons: Seems like the bottom line is more important than the employee satisfaction.  Lowest pay compared to other area hospitals.

review_title: No Job in 5 years...Do not waste your time!

cons: Under Paid,  No Raises, Stressful, Disrespectful Employees, Incompetent Nurses.

pros: Excellent patient care and focus on service.  The best hospital in our area.

pros: Great Place and people, opportunities to advance, good pay.
cons: People die occasionally, and there are. It enough Chaplains.
